English: In the morning
In the evening

Citizens of the republic of Everon!
This is Colonel Johnson speaking, the commanding officer of the American forces that entered your island today.
On an invitation from your president Edouard Daladier,
we have come to offer you protection and safeguard your nation from outside threats.

The Soviet forces on a nearby island of Kolguyev are amassing troops. Their activity in the past year has increased threefold.\nThey pose an imminent danger to your island.\nThey tried to claim Everon seven years ago and now it is all but certain they would try to do so again.

We saved you once before, dear citizens of Everon, and we are here to do the same.\nPlease do not resist our units and heed their orders.\nDo not try to get in our way for we will be forced to act harshly although we do not wish to hurt you.

You should feel safe as you go to sleep tonight knowing that our great forces watch over your shores, cities, farms and meadows.\nWe are your guardians and will put our lives on the line to make sure your island will never become another battlefield in the future.\nI wish you all goodnight!
Bunch of bullshit.
This is exactly the same as seven years ago. Only this time we actually invited them over.\nIs the price we paid in blood not enough to grant us peace?
Our bases were occupied. They commandeered our weapons, tanks and the few choppers that ve had.\nThe militia was disbanded and we are marked as traitors with orders to shoot on sight.
This is like a bad dream come true. How did it all go to shit so quickly?

It is not over, Gaston. We are still here, still fighting. You led us seven years ago even in the direst of situations.\nRemember the Soviets? Remember how shattered we were? You brought us back. You gave us our freedom.

The freedom which was taken away from us, I know.\nI hoped after the French legions and our departure from France we could find a place to live in peace.\nBut there is always something in the way, always!

But you are right. The battle is not over until there are people still willing to fight on.\nWe are the free people of Everon!\nWe deserve our freedom the same as everyone else! If freedom is not granted we shall fight for it!
Yeah, Gaston!
Hear, hear!
First, we need to send a message that we are still here and that we did not give up.\nDaladier betrayed our nation and thus I condemn him to death. We shall be the executors.

Get some sleep, we're starting in the morning.\nIt's time to rekindle the people's hearts again and together we shall drive the occupants back into the sea.\nFor free Everon we fight, the resistance reborn! Who's with me?!
For free Everon! Vivat Gaston! Vivat the resistance!
Get in the car. I'll explain the plan along the way.
Alright, men, listen up. Daladier is in Montignac and will be going to Saint Pierre shortly to pay a visit to that Johnson fella.
He will not arrive.
They know we're still out there, they'll want to secure him. He hates flying so they will send a convoy.\nI expect some infantry and a few armoured vehicles.
We will need heavy weapons to deal with that. We'll get them from our American friends.\nI received news that ammo trucks were sent to Entre Deux. They should provide anything we might need.

They won't expect an attack so close to Montignac, but we'll need to be fast.\nWe take the trucks, meet the others on the farm between Chotain and Laruns.\nWe wait for the convoy and blast it to smithereens.
We know the land and we are determined. We'll get our island back from the occupants.\nGet ready, for the battle for our island starts at this moment!
We follow your lead, Gaston.
We're here. Let's go, men.
This is precisely what we need.
And there's even more of it there. We're gonna have to load it onto the trucks.
Jean, go get our jeep and park it here. We'll start hauling those crates.
We know you're in there. Walk out with your hands behind your head!
We've got you surrounded. Surrender now and you can all return home!
You have nowhere to go! Give up now!
Alright, they do not care to listen to reason. Prepare the petrol, fire should force them out.
The whoresons! I have to get rid of them before the men inside burn to death!
That should be all of them. Now to free those inside the church.
Thanks for the help. That was very close back there.
No problem. What did you do to piss them off so much?
We did have a shootout with them earlier and might have gotten a few.
What happened?

What do you think? We were on our way to the meeting point when we met a patrol.\nThere was a fight, we took them out, but then more of them came so we hid in the church.\nWe didn't think they would set it on fire.
Hm, kind of makes one wonder why those petrol canisters look like the ones we use for tractors.\nMust be a coincidence then?

What are you on about, man? Alright, yes, we did plan to lure them here and set the church on fire.\nThough it got out of control and we were the ones inside the church and not the other way around.\nAre you a police or something? Why do you even care?
I do care because we're fighting for a just cause here. We are not freaking animals.\nIt's a fine line that you do not want to cross, believe me.
Well, it was a stupid idea anyway. We hear you, man.\nYou're not half bad. I'm Pierre Calvet, nice to meet you. What do they call you?
Jean Poincare.
Wait, Poincare? You mean the Poincare? Gaston's right hand ...
Good that you're all alive, men, but that church is beyond saving.\nWe should head out, we have work to do. Get in and follow!
Thank you for coming, everybody. The convoy will be here soon. We are not many but we have a surprise on our side.

We are team Fox, team Raven is on the other side of the road and will notify us when the convoy's coming.\nTogether we attack and destroy all opposition and seize our dear president Daladier, the traitor.
Equip any weapon by your preference from the crates over there. Get ready quickly. We set out soon.

It was thrilling to do battle again. We once again fought for our freedom, for our island and nation.\nAnd once again we went against one of the strongest powers on Earth. But we were determined to fight till the bitter end.
I don't have time for this. I should get back to our mission.
KEEP CLOSE IN FORMATION. WE'LL BE SWIFT AND WE'LL BE DEADLY. LET'S SHOW THEM HOW WE FIGHT ON EVERON!
GOOD WORK, MEN. LET'S SEE WHAT THEY'VE GOT THERE.
JEAN, I JUST RECEIVED A DISTRESS CALL FROM OUR MEN. THEY WERE HAVING SOME TROUBLE IN CHOTAIN. GO AND TAKE A LOOK, WE'LL JOIN YOU ONCE WE FULLY LOAD THE TRUCKS.
UNDERSTOOD, GASTON. I'M ON MY WAY.
EVERYONE'S HERE ALREADY. GOOD. LET'S GET READY THEN.
RAVEN TO FOX, THE CONVOY'S HERE. THERE ARE TWO TANKS AND THREE TRUCKS, POSSIBLY FULL OF INFANTRY. OVER.
FOX HEARS YOU, RAVEN. WE SHALL STRIKE WHEN THEY GET CLOSER. ATTACK THEM FROM THE OTHER SIDE. GOOD LUCK. OUT.
GET READY, MEN! TRY TO TARGET THE TANKS FIRST!
FOX TO ALL MEN, LET'S GO! FOR EVERON! FOR FREE PEOPLE!
Take Over Trucks
Investigate the Distress Call
Rendezvous with Others
Destroy Daladier's Convoy
Raven
Fox
Raven
Your time is limited
You still have some time
You are running out of time
You have almost no time left
You have failed to save the men trapped in church in time\n\nMission failed
You have failed to keep a vital piece of equipment functional\n\nMission failed
